original: MANNERSTEDT, Folke Karl Erik, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 5/4 01 av öv.-löjtn P V S M o Elin Kling, gm Karin Palm-qvist. Studex Sthlm 19, prakt motorrn till sjöss o i USA 20, civingex KTH (förbränn.-motorer) 27. Motorkonstr o experimenting v öl företag 26—27, motortekn exp o ch f tävl.verks v Fabriques Nationales d’Armes de Guerre’s sv bol 27—29, ch f Husqv Vapen-fabr AB:s motorcykeltillverkn 29—35, motor-exp f Husqv Vapenfabr AB samt eg konsult verksamh i Sthlm sed. 35, lär i motortekn, termodynamik o flygmotorlära v STI sed. 36, lär i motortekn v AIHS, konstr.ch h Lovén & Co AB 39—41. Konstr samtl motorer byggda v Huskvarna 29—35 samt de segrande maskinerna v ett flert tävl, bl a ett europ, fyra sv o ett franskt Grand Prix samt Avusloppet 35, konstr sv arméns motorcyklar av 42 o 43 års modeller. Inneh en mängd sakk.uppdrag f myndigh o föreningar, försäkr- o automo-bilbolag, advokatfmor mfl. Led av KAK :s tekn kté, Motormännens Riksfrbs tekn kté, Sv Tekn.frn, Sv Konsult Ingrs Frn.
translated: MANNERSTEDT, Folke Karl Erik, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on April 5, 1901, son of Lieutenant P V S M and Elin Kling, married Karin Palmqvist. Completed high school in Stockholm in 1919, worked as a marine engineer and in the United States in 1920, obtained a degree in engineering from the Royal Institute of Technology (specializing in internal combustion engines) in 1927. Worked as an engine designer and experimenter for various companies between 1926 and 1927, served as the technical expert and chief of the competition department at Fabriques Nationales d'Armes de Guerre's Swedish branch between 1927 and 1929, and as the chief of Husqvarna Weapon Factory AB's motorcycle manufacturing department from 1929 to 1935. Continued to work as a motor expert for Husqvarna Weapon Factory AB and as an independent consultant in Stockholm from 1935. Taught engine technology, thermodynamics, and aeronautical engine engineering at the Swedish Technical Institute from 1936, and engine technology at the Industrial Institute of Higher Studies. Served as the chief designer at Lovén & Co AB from 1939 to 1941. Designed various engines for Huskvarna from 1929 to 1935, including the winning machines in several competitions, such as a European, four Swedish, and a French Grand Prix, as well as the Avus Race in 1935. Designed motorcycles for the Swedish Army in 1942 and 1943. Received numerous professional assignments from authorities, associations, insurance and automobile companies, law firms, and others. Member of the technical committee of the Royal Automobile Club and the Swedish Motorists' National Association, the Swedish Engineering Association, and the Swedish Consultancy Engineering Association.

structured.name: Folke Karl Erik Mannerstedt
structured.description: Swedish civil engineer and engine designer.

career.occupational_title: Technical Expert and Chief of Competition Department
career.workplace: Fabriques Nationales d'Armes de Guerre's Swedish Branch
